title: Nike Has a New CEO, and ServiceNow’s Stock Is Tumbling
text:
ServiceNow tumbled 10% on Tuesday afternoon after its chief executive was named the new CEO of Nike, effective early next year.

The back story. Nike shares (ticker:NKE) have jumped nearly 29% year to date, compared with a 19.5% gain for the S&P 500 in the same period, and ongoing struggles for many of its retail peers. The trade war hasn’t hit Nike as hard as some feared, and while some analysts are worried about the impact on sales in China, bulls have been quick to point to other catalysts for the stock, including...
description: Mark Parker has overseen a period of growth at Nike and will become chairman when he hands the CEO reins to John Donahoe of ServiceNow
